audio_caption: The audio clip begins with applause, followed by a male speaker starting a presentation with an informative tone, mentioning getting everyone on the same page and reminding the audience what Khan Academy does. As the speaker continues, the sound of a whooshing object is heard. The speaker then continues on the topic of interactions and gravity.

The audio clip opens with a man speaking in a tone of academic interest, describing a historical period following Isaac Newton. Another speaker, likely a woman, expresses pleasure in something. Then, a man asks if it's possible to determine which light bulb is being switched. Another male voice asks why humidity makes something feel hotter, prompting another man to say "excellent question." A woman says she's experimenting with numbers to create colors. Next, a man discusses how certain things can interbreed, before joking about mechanics being difficult. A sound of laughter then transitions to a man saying it's not just a video.

The clip begins with a male speaker, presenting in a confident and informative tone, who introduces the interactive side of Khan Academy, highlighting their computer science platform developed by John Resig. He continues, describing the mission to provide a free world-class education with deep practice and feedback, incorporating state-of-the-art analytics and tools for teachers. He then shares statistics regarding user growth and problem completion on Khan Academy since a TED talk three years prior, and concluding with thanks. This speech is followed by applause.

The clip begins with a male speaker highlighting the interesting things happening in classrooms, noting Khan Academy isn't a "silver bullet" but can lead to "incredible things" when used in conjunction with great teachers who encourage student ownership and learning. The speaker describes percentile scores from a 9th-grade algebra class in Oakland, California, which improved from the 20th percentile to the 99th percentile.  Audience applause follows.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing how 90% of users are trying to tap into their potential, and introduces an upcoming video example. The speaker's tone is informative and encouraging. Following the speech is a sound effect, which seems to be a *whooshing* sound.

The clip features a single male speaker who describes his academic struggles in high school, including dropping out twice and being placed in lower-level classes. He discusses discovering Khan Academy, which allowed him to skip two years' worth of math, and getting the highest scores on the exam. The speaker expresses that Khan Academy changed the trajectory of his life and inspired him to love math and science. His tone throughout the clip is conversational, and earnest.

The audio clip starts with applause, then shifts to a male speaker expressing gratitude towards Khan Academy. He mentions graduating as valedictorian, attending Princeton as a computer science major, and his passion for computers, math, and science. The speaker expresses appreciation for Khan Academy's impact and encourages them to continue their work, stating, "you're really changing lives."

The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing how a situation has "come full circle." He mentions finding out someone is a computer science major and offering them an internship. He continues by saying the person interviewed well and will join them this summer to "build the tools" for the "next generation." The speaker sounds happy and excited, and the clip concludes with the sound of applause.

The audio clip begins with a male speaker making an announcement, referring to a statement made by the College Board in 2016 regarding the SAT. The speaker notes that the College Board recognized inequality in access to test preparation. The speaker says they are partnering with Khan Academy to develop the best test prep, focusing on tools for practice, analytics, and feedback to "level the playing field." He adds that Khan Academy is expanding beyond the English-speaking world, with Spanish and Portuguese versions already available and other languages planned. Throughout his speech, the tone is informative and enthusiastic.

The audio begins with a male speaker introducing the next video. This is followed by snippets of various languages spoken. The voices consist of both male and female speakers, whose tonality is conversational. Lastly, someone is heard speaking followed by a group conversation.

The clip starts with a single male speaker with an excited tone reflecting on growth, mentioning something "surreal" and how the organization started in a "walk-in closet." He continues detailing the company's expansion from a seven-person organization to sixty, and that it's engaged thousands of volunteers and "200,000 teachers." He concludes by referencing the use of Khan Academy "all over the planet."

The audio clip begins with a male speaker contemplating past perceptions of literacy and how that related to beliefs about human capability. He then proposes a contemporary thought experiment relating to research, genetics, computer science, and robotics; he argues current perceptions of expertise may be pessimistic. He delivers his monologue in a conversational tone.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker excitedly describing the potential of the next 5 to 50 years, focusing on education as a fundamental human right. He ends the speech with a thankful expression. The audience applauds, creating a loud and enthusiastic soundscape. Another male speaker then comes on and says: “Fantastic, so listen”.

The clip begins with a male speaker asking a question about Khan Academy use. The question is about what education will look like in twenty years, and whether it will happen at home or school. The tone is inquisitive. Next, a second male speaker answers by speculating that there will always be classrooms, but that education will be "self-directed, much more interactive", and involve building portfolios. The tone is thoughtful and optimistic. Following this answer, the first male speaker says "you're doing as much as anyone in the world to realize that future". The tone of voice is supportive and congratulatory. After a thank you, clapping concludes the audio.
